data.title: Michael Connelly: ‘I’ve been ripped off, like a victim of crime’
data.meta_description: The author has racked up 85 million book sales with Harry Bosch and the Lincoln Lawyer — now he’s fighting to stop ChatGPT writing sequels in his name
data.text:
It’s early morning in Los Angeles, and from his study Michael Connelly has a view of the Hollywood Hills. It’s a vision of quiet serenity, far from the fast-paced thrills of his 38 bestselling novels and the television hits they have spawned. His two protagonists, the LAPD detective Hieronymus “Harry” Bosch and the defence attorney Mickey Haller, now also the star of the Netflix series The Lincoln Lawyer, rarely experience such peace.

But now the 67-year-old author’s life has inched a little closer to his fiction: in September Connelly filed a class action lawsuit against OpenAI, the company behind the generative AI app ChatGPT.
